body.p: “I see many birch scales “,” freshly blown over the snow. They are falling all winter. What is that narrow “,” twisted “,” yellowish-brown scale which is seen on the snow all winter near woods? Shaped like this:--[image]
PE 10, pg. 189 / 4 January-23 April 1856 / NNPM MA 1302:26 / T vol. # XX / PDF # XIV / JVIII
